subject: Languages
title: Vulgar Latin: The Language of the Streets
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Vulgar Latin: The Language of the Streets.

hook.text: Classical Latin was for senators and poets. The soldiers and merchants spoke something messier.

buildup.text: Vulgar Latin was the everyday spoken language of the Roman Empire's common people.

discovery.text: It differed from written Latin in grammar, pronunciation, and vocabulary.

twist.text: When the empire fell, Vulgar Latin didn't die â€” it evolved differently in each region.

climax.text: Those regional variations became Spanish, French, Italian, Portuguese, and Romanian.

punchline.text: Five modern languages grew from the slang that scholars looked down on.

quiz.question: What was Vulgar Latin?
options: The everyday spoken Latin of common people
